definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: Player must shoot the attackers of zombi .
sentences.chinese: 玩家必須射殺那些喪屍。

sentences.english: He'd watched them on the monitor and thought how like zombies they were.
sentences.chinese: 他從監視器裏看着他們，想着他們多麼像喪屍。

sentences.english: Kill 25 player controlled zombies with a melee attack.
sentences.chinese: 用近戰殺死25名玩家控制的喪屍。

sentences.english: 'The Walking Dead' will be back for a third season of zombie goodness.
sentences.chinese: 我們將能看到超好看喪屍美劇《形式走肉》的第三季。

sentences.english: They make us feel like a zombie apocalypse could hit us any moment.
sentences.chinese: 這些人讓我們覺得喪屍危機隨時可能在我們身邊爆發。

sentences.english: Zombies are officially the new vampires.
sentences.chinese: 喪屍正式成爲新版吸血鬼。

definition: you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
person/number of people/(per) capita/(a person's) head/(Tw) person whose identity is used by sb else (e.g. to create a bogus account)
